pullRequest.body:
This develops preliminaries for the construction of the adjunction between the 2-truncated nerve and the 2-truncated homotopy category functor. The key technical result is `toNerve₂.mk` and `toNerve₂.ext`, which demonstrates that a map of 2-truncated simplicial sets valued in a 2-truncated nerve is determined uniquely by the underlying refl prefunctor provided a composition hypothesis is met. 

---

This supports #16784. 


[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

The comment at the header of the new file better reflects what will be done in #16784 than what is done here (preliminary work that is not useful on its own). If this is objectionable, let me know, and I'll replace this with something stubby.

Thanks!

:lock: Permission denied

Existing reviewers: [click here to make emilyriehl a reviewer](https://mathlib-bors-ca18eefec4cb.herokuapp.com/repositories/16/add-reviewer/emilyriehl)
bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/13549206888/job/37868444666)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/13549206888/job/37868444187)

Could you declare an abbrev for `(MorphismProperty.naturalityProperty (fun n => toNerve₂.mk.app F n.unop)).unop` and state the sequence of `have _ : OK ... := ...` in the proof as separate lemmas (maybe `mk_naturality_aux₁/₂/₃`
Done.

I think that wherever it may make sense in this file, the parameters `C : Cat.{u, u}` should be replaced by `(C : Type u) [SmallCategory C]`. For example, this one should become:
```lean
def nerve₂Adj.counit.app {C : Type u} [SmallCategory C] :
    ((SSet.truncation 2).obj (nerve C)).HomotopyCategory ⥤ C := by
```
Happy to do this. BTW the current version still compiles but there's a linter error that appeared while breaking out the lemmas you requested that I don't understand.

Done. BTW one effect is a proliferation of `nerveFunctor₂.obj (Cat.of C)`. In a previous draft we had defined 
```nerve₂ C := nerveFunctor₂.obj (Cat.of C)```
which would fit in more naturally with these auxiliary lemmas but I remember this being annoying to work with because ultimately we're trying to define functors and natural transformations involving `Cat.{u,u}`. For a small illustration note that the previous def
```
def nerve₂Adj.counit : nerveFunctor₂ ⋙ hoFunctor₂.{u} ⟶ (𝟭 Cat) where
  app := nerve₂Adj.counit.app
  naturality := nerve₂Adj.counit.naturality
```
is now
```
def nerve₂Adj.counit : nerveFunctor₂ ⋙ hoFunctor₂.{u} ⟶ (𝟭 Cat) where
  app := fun _ ↦ nerve₂Adj.counit.app (Cat.of _)
  naturality := fun _ _ F ↦ nerve₂Adj.counit.naturality F
```
which isn't the end of the world, but I remember this being more of an annoyance in proofs.
Some lemmas like `δ₂_zero_comp_σ₂_zero` were introduced in the file `SimplicialSet.HomotopyCat`. That API should be expanded so that we may just use a basic `rw` here and in a few other places.

I was wondering actually whether it was better to reprove this stuff for `SimplexCategory.Truncated 2` or try to appeal back to the general results from `SimplexCategory`. The latter appealed to me aesthetically but in practice seemed hard to use (couldn't `rw`; instead had to `conv_rhs => apply`). The issue seemed to be confusions about things like `1 + 1 = 2` and specific proofs of inequalities.

Anyway the easiest thing would certainly be to just add these lemmas, so I can do this for now. But maybe in the future we want to reconsider whether we can deploy the general `SimplexCategory` morphism infrastructure more effectively in truncated settings.

`conv => apply` is very rarely used in mathlib. If we can make `rw` work, it is certainly a better option. If it works in these proofs, introducing general lemmas `SimplexCategory.Truncated.δ/σ_comp_δ/σ` which parallel the similar lemmas from the `SimplexCategory` namespace would be a good option, but adding for some ad hoc lemmas specifically for the `2`-truncated case is also an acceptable option IMO. (The larger issue is that our API for full subcategories is not very satisfactory at the moment...)

@digama0 I mostly completed this but it could use a little golfing in the `HomotopyCategory.lean` file. 

The following two lemmas should be combinable
```
/-- Abbreviations for face maps in the 2-truncated simplex category. -/
abbrev δ₂ {n} (i : Fin (n + 2)) (hn := by decide) (hn' := by decide) :
    (⟨⦋n⦌, hn⟩ : SimplexCategory.Truncated 2) ⟶ ⟨⦋n + 1⦌, hn'⟩ := SimplexCategory.δ i

/-- Abbreviations for degeneracy maps in the 2-truncated simplex category. -/
abbrev σ₂ {n} (i : Fin (n + 1)) (hn := by decide) (hn' := by decide) :
    (⟨⦋n+1⦌, hn⟩ : SimplexCategory.Truncated 2) ⟶ ⟨⦋n⦌, hn'⟩ := SimplexCategory.σ i

@[reassoc (attr := simp)]
lemma δ₂_zero_comp_σ₂_zero : δ₂ (0 : Fin 2) ≫ σ₂ 0 = 𝟙 _ := SimplexCategory.δ_comp_σ_self

@[reassoc (attr := simp)]
lemma δ₂_zero_comp_σ₂_zero' : δ₂ (0 : Fin 3) ≫ σ₂ 0 = 𝟙 _ := SimplexCategory.δ_comp_σ_self
```
The first is the case `n := 0` and the second is the case `n := 1`. But I was having a bit of trouble stating the hypothesis `hn` correctly.

Similarly for
```
@[reassoc (attr := simp)]
lemma δ₂_one_comp_σ₂_zero : δ₂ (1 : Fin 2) ≫ σ₂ 0 = 𝟙 _ := SimplexCategory.δ_comp_σ_succ

@[reassoc (attr := simp)]
lemma δ₂_one_comp_σ₂_zero' : δ₂ (1 : Fin 3) ≫ σ₂ 0 = 𝟙 _ := SimplexCategory.δ_comp_σ_succ
```

There is probably some missing API here. First, I think you should add lemmas like this one, about the faces/degeneracies of the nerve in low degrees:
```lean
lemma nerve.σ_zero_eq_mk_id {C : Type u} [SmallCategory C] (x : C) :
    (nerve C).σ (0 : Fin 1) (.mk₀ x) = .mk₁ (𝟙 x) :=
  ComposableArrows.ext₁ rfl rfl (by dsimp [nerve]; aesop)
```
Using this one, I can make some progress in the proof of this lemma:
```lean
lemma toNerve₂.mk_naturality_σ00 {X : SSet.Truncated.{u} 2} {C : Cat}
    (F : SSet.oneTruncation₂.obj X ⟶ ReflQuiv.of C) :
    toNerve₂.mk.naturalityProperty F (σ₂ (n := 0) 0) := by
  ext x
  refine Eq.trans ?_ (nerve.σ_zero_eq_mk_id (C := C) (F.obj x)).symm
  have := ReflPrefunctor.map_id F x
  dsimp at this ⊢
  rw [← this]
  simp only [← OneTruncation₂.id_edge x]
  sorry
```
With suitable API, I think this goal could be closed in a relatively clean manner.
It is likely that similar arguments may help for the other cases.

I was able to complete this case, though I wouldn't say this is `clean` yet. On the other hands, this is part of the infrastructure that will almost certainly get cut once we can generalize `toNerve₂.mk` to 2-truncated strict Segal things.

I found this:
```lean
universe v' u'

lemma ReflPrefunctor.congr_mk₁_map
    {Y : Type u'} [ReflQuiver.{v'} Y] {C : Type u} [Category.{v} C]
    (F : ReflPrefunctor Y (ReflQuiv.of C))
    {x₁ y₁ x₂ y₂ : Y} (f : x₁ ⟶ y₁) (g : x₂ ⟶ y₂)
    (hx : x₁ = x₂) (hy : y₁ = y₂) (hfg : Quiver.homOfEq f hx hy = g):
    ComposableArrows.mk₁ (C := C) (F.map f) =
      ComposableArrows.mk₁ (C := C) (F.map g) := by
  subst hx hy
  obtain rfl : f = g := by simpa using hfg
  rfl

@[simp]
lemma _root_.SSet.OneTruncation₂.homOfEq_edge
    {X : SSet.Truncated.{u} 2} {x₁ y₁ x₂ y₂ : OneTruncation₂ X}
    (f : x₁ ⟶ y₁) (hx : x₁ = x₂) (hy : y₁ = y₂) :
    (Quiver.homOfEq f hx hy).edge = f.edge := by
  subst hx hy
  rfl

lemma toNerve₂.mk_naturality_σ00 {X : SSet.Truncated.{u} 2} {C : Type u} [SmallCategory C]
    (F : SSet.oneTruncation₂.obj X ⟶ ReflQuiv.of C) :
    toNerve₂.mk.naturalityProperty F (σ₂ (n := 0) 0) := by
  ext x
  refine Eq.trans ?_ (nerve.σ_zero_eq_mk_id (C := C) (F.obj x)).symm
  have := ReflPrefunctor.map_id F x
  dsimp at this ⊢
  rw [← this, ← OneTruncation₂.id_edge x]
  fapply ReflPrefunctor.congr_mk₁_map
  · simp [← FunctorToTypes.map_comp_apply, ← op_comp]
  · simp [← FunctorToTypes.map_comp_apply, ← op_comp]
  · aesop
```
Thanks. I wrote a few lemmas to attempt to simplify the last bad case `toNerve₂.mk_naturality_δ1i` which I left in the same file so you can see whether you like them. These are the `nerve_δ2i`.
Similarly as I suggested replacing `C : Cat` by `(C : Type u) [SmallCategory C]`, the morphism `F` should be replaced by a functor from `C` to `D`.
I tried this but then couldn't complete the proof.

I'll push this version but see the use of `F'` here:
```
/-- Naturality of `nerve₂Adj.counit.app` is proven using `HomotopyCategory.lift_unique'`. -/
theorem nerve₂Adj.counit.naturality ⦃C D : Type u⦄ [SmallCategory C] [SmallCategory D]
    (F : C ⥤ D) :
    (nerveFunctor₂ ⋙ hoFunctor₂).map F ⋙ nerve₂Adj.counit.app D =
      nerve₂Adj.counit.app C ⋙ F := by
  apply HomotopyCategory.lift_unique'
  conv => lhs; rw [← Functor.assoc]; lhs; apply (hoFunctor₂_naturality _).symm
  simp only [Cat.freeRefl_obj_α, ReflQuiv.of_val, comp_obj, Functor.comp_map]
  rw [← Functor.assoc _ _ F]
  conv => rhs; lhs; exact (nerve₂Adj.counit.app_eq C)
  let F' : (Cat.of C) ⟶ (Cat.of D) := F
  conv => rhs; exact ((whiskerRight OneTruncation₂.ofNerve₂.natIso.hom Cat.freeRefl ≫
    ReflQuiv.adj.counit).naturality F').symm
  simp only [app, Cat.comp_eq_comp, Functor.comp_map, Functor.assoc,
    SSet.Truncated.HomotopyCategory.quotientFunctor]
  rw [Quotient.lift_spec]
```

This is probably because the naturality property that is used was stated only in terms of `Cat`. Ideally, this should have first been stated in the "unbundled context" (types with quiver/category structures rather than terms in `Cat/ReflQuiv/etc`), but there is no need to fix that now, I would say.

This syntax is more common in mathlib:
```suggestion
theorem nerve₂Adj.counit.naturality {C D : Type u} [SmallCategory C] [SmallCategory D]
```
Done.

It is advisable to use the `where` syntax:
```suggestion
  app C := nerve₂Adj.counit.app (Cat.of C)
  naturality _ _ F := nerve₂Adj.counit.naturality F
```
Non-terminal `simp` have to be squeezed, using `simp?`.
This should be moved to another file, maybe `ComposableArrows.lean`.
The nerve isn't defined until `Nerve.lean`, so I moved this there.
This should go in `Nerve.lean`.
Done and renamed to `nerve.δ22_eq` to match the name of something (related, not quite identical) there.

```suggestion
      simp only [← FunctorToTypes.map_comp_apply, ← op_comp]
      have := δ_comp_δ (n := 0) (i := 0) (j := 1) (by decide)
      dsimp at this
```
Done.

```suggestion
      simp only [← FunctorToTypes.map_comp_apply, ← op_comp]
      have := δ_comp_δ (n := 0) (i := 0) (j := 0) (by decide)
      dsimp at this
```

```suggestion
      simp only [← FunctorToTypes.map_comp_apply, ← op_comp]
```

```suggestion
      dsimp at this
```
Done.

```suggestion
    · dsimp only [Fin.zero_eta]
```

```suggestion
    · dsimp only [Fin.mk_one]
```

```suggestion
      (f ≫ (OneTruncation₂.ofNerve₂.natIso.app (Cat.of C)).hom).map (ev02₂ φ) =
      CategoryStruct.comp (obj := (Cat.of C))
```
Done.

```suggestion
    obtain ⟨φ⟩ := rel
    simpa [ReflQuiv.adj, Quot.liftOn, Cat.FreeRefl.quotientFunctor, Quotient.functor,
        Quiv.adj, OneTruncation₂.nerveHomEquiv] using
      φ.map_comp (X := 0) (Y := 1) (Z := 2) (homOfLE (by decide)) (homOfLE (by decide))
```
Done.
Could you try to remove the `conv => apply/exact` chunks?
Could you? If not, I think it should stay as is, maybe with a todo.
If `erw` is considered as "technical debt" that we should try to avoid, the same should certainly apply also to `conv => apply/exact`.

Okay. But maybe this PR isn't the right place to be doing this. If you have a concrete alternative suggestion to make, please do so, but if it's just an eww please just bring it up on mathlib's centralized tech debt counter infrastructure instead of asking us to deal with this on a deadline. `conv` is not a banned tactic.

(I also disagree that this is even to be avoided. It's just a very explicit rewrite which specifies exactly where to do the rewrite and sidesteps issues of matching. Maybe rw or simp would do this rewrite if the simp set was better, but the result would be both longer and slower than this.)

```lean
/-- Naturality of `nerve₂Adj.counit.app` is proven using `HomotopyCategory.lift_unique'`. -/
theorem nerve₂Adj.counit.naturality {C D : Type u} [SmallCategory C] [SmallCategory D]
    (F : C ⥤ D) :
    (nerveFunctor₂ ⋙ hoFunctor₂).map F ⋙ nerve₂Adj.counit.app D =
      nerve₂Adj.counit.app C ⋙ F := by
  apply HomotopyCategory.lift_unique'
  change ((oneTruncation₂ ⋙ Cat.freeRefl).map (nerveFunctor₂.map _)) ⋙
    HomotopyCategory.quotientFunctor (nerveFunctor₂.obj (Cat.of D)) ⋙ app D = _
  rw [nerve₂Adj.counit.app_eq D]
  conv_rhs => rw [← Functor.assoc, nerve₂Adj.counit.app_eq C]
  exact (whiskerRight OneTruncation₂.ofNerve₂.natIso.{u}.hom Cat.freeRefl ≫
    ReflQuiv.adj.counit).naturality _
```
Thanks.
Untested, but `nerve C` is a simplicial, so that `(nerve C).δ 2` should work. Same below.
Done, thanks.
I would suggest using the name `σ₀_mk₀_eq`, and similarly below.
Done.
It would probably be better to use `⦋...⦌` (here and below) as this is soon going to be the notation in the general truncated case.
Done.

```suggestion
/-- The naturality of `nerve₂Adj.counit.app`. -/
```

```suggestion
def nerve₂Adj.counit : nerveFunctor₂ ⋙ hoFunctor₂.{u} ⟶ 𝟭 Cat where
```

```suggestion
  app n := toNerve₂.mk.app F n.unop
```

```suggestion
maps in `SimplexCategory.Truncated 2`. -/
```

The docstring should be clarified: out of context, when we hover on the name of this definition, we should be able to understand most of what this is about. Here, I think it should be something like "The morphism `X ⟶ nerveFunctor₂.obj (Cat.of C)` of 2-truncated simplicial sets that is constructed from ...(which data)... under ...(which assumption).".
Done.
It seems you could put this definition and the next in a section with the same variables. (`obj := (Cat.of C)` should probably be replaced by `obj := C`.)
Done.
I think you should state a general lemma about refl-quivers, and combine it with the ext lemma for `OneTruncation₂.Hom`.
Done. See new `Quiver.heq_of_homOfEq_ext`.

```suggestion
```
